intro: Raffenaldia, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, often fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plants are generally herbaceous, with linear or lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Raffenaldia species are typically found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. They play a role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments and are sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
